description: This app works fine on my Linux Lite 5.8 HP Pressario computer. Quick to launch and does the job nicely. Doesn't have plenty of bells and whistles. Interface simple enough for 99% of all users.
There's no problem with the app, it works properly
I just could not figure out where the screen shot is saved. It is not on home/XXX/Pictures/Screen Shots/.

This software has the best minimalistic GUI that I ever seen but, nothing is saved in /home/currentuser/pictures. After capturing, there is a notification indicating that path however that folder is empty.
KDE Neon - Plasma

May, June, July, September, November, and now October since the comments I see have reported that it does not work, yet, this app is still available and still broken ... I feel bad for having to say something so obvious : Shouldn't it be either removed from the store or fixed after 5 months that it has been reported as broken? If it's not going to be fixed, it should be removed, letting broken software available gives the sensation to be on beta, amateur software ...
summary: As others have said months before me, it does not save the screenshot

description: This tool works just fine and certainly does NOT deserve a 1 star rating!!
summary: Great app, would recommend; it works!

description:
I installed this application onto my Steam Deck. I do not have any issues with the images I capture showing up in the pictures folder, but the program seems to have issues capturing what I select with an external monitor hooked up.

I have the external monitor oriented above the Steam Deck, and if I select an area to capture on the Steam Deck's screen, the saved image is black, and if I attempt to capture a selection from the external monitor, then the image will contain the respective portion of the Steam Deck's monitor.
